title: [Large-Scale] Physics Problem-Solving Skill Enhancement Course Using Flipped Learning and Self/Peer Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic physics concepts and secondary-level mathematics proficiency
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited-technology environment using smartphones for in-service secondary teachers; development of problem-solving skills applicable to actual classroom settings through project-based learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain physics problem-solving steps in three or more phases based on flipped learning content
Learners can evaluate peers' problem-solving processes and suggest at least three feedback items
Learners can apply concepts and propose solutions to given physics problems with 80% accuracy

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
